justification: "Before and after MTPs, the participants were asked to rate the degree to which they shared personal identity of the wearing facial disguise by answering the question 'To what degree you identify yourself as the facial disguise?' on a 7-point Likert scale."

"We further assessed MTP effects on personal identity shift by quantifying behavioural responses in a perceptual matching task that revealed a self-prioritization effect (i.e., faster and more accurate responses to associate a shape with the self than others)."
"Participants… answered two questions 'To what degree you identify yourself as Asian (or White)?' on a 7-point Likert scale."

measured_by: Racial face categorization task (reaction times to Asian vs White faces)
justification: "We measured RTs to White and Asian faces in this task… to assess racial identity shift across MTPs."

measured_by: mPFC activity during self-referential fMRI task
justification: "Reflection on the self when viewing the facial disguise… would induce stronger mPFC activity… we extracted BOLD signals from the mPFC that was engaged in reflection of one’s own social attributes including race."
construct: Neural representation of shifted racial identity

measured_by: P2 ERP amplitude (150–200 ms) to painful vs neutral expressions
justification: "Previous EEG research has identified a greater neural response… at 150-200 ms… we focused on whether the racial ingroup bias in the P2 amplitudes…"
construct: Racial ingroup bias in empathy (early neural)

measured_by: fMRI BOLD response in right premotor/IFC/insula to painful vs non-painful stimuli
justification: "ROI analyses… examined whether WMTP compared to AMTP increased neural responses to White models' pain in two networks… right IFC, premotor cortex, and insula."
construct: Racial ingroup bias in empathy (brain network)

measured_by: Monetary donation choice task with morphed faces
justification: "Participants were asked to donate ¥10 to one of the two faces… choices were fitted to a generalized linear mixed-effect model to assess how altruistic decision-making was sensitive to race-related information."
construct: Racial ingroup bias in altruistic decision-making

measured_by: Race version of the Implicit Association Test (IAT)
justification: "Participants… performed a race version of the Implicit Association Test… a D score was calculated… to estimate implicit racial attitudes."
construct: Implicit racial attitudes toward White faces
